content.question: Which of the following represents a molecule with a trigonal bipyramidal geometry?

choices.label: The figure shows a Lewis diagram. An I atom with one pair of nonbonding electrons is at the center of the diagram. The I atom is connected to five F atoms, each by a single bond. Each F atom has three pairs of nonbonding electrons.
The figure shows a Lewis diagram. A P atom is at the center of the diagram. The P atom is connected to five F atoms, each by a single bond. Each F atom has three pairs of nonbonding electrons.
The figure shows a Lewis diagram. A C atom is at the center of the diagram. The C atom is connected to four F atoms, each by a single bond. Each F atom has three pairs of nonbonding electrons.

The figure shows a Lewis diagram. An X e atom with two pairs of nonbonding electrons is at the center of the diagram. The X e atom is connected to four F atoms, each by a single bond. Each F atom has three pairs of nonbonding electrons.

content.answer: The figure shows a Lewis diagram. A P atom is at the center of the diagram. The P atom is connected to five F atoms, each by a single bond. Each F atom has three pairs of nonbonding electrons.

skill.text: 1.A: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate particulate-level properties only.
